message.content:
cs.CL, cs.AI, cs.LG, cs.NE, cs.CV. 

This paper is about improving neural machine translation (NMT) for languages without natural word delimiters, such as Chinese. Therefore, it is likely to belong to the natural language processing (NLP) sub-category of computer science, which is cs.CL. Additionally, the proposed method involves using recurrent neural networks (RNNs) and word lattices, which are common techniques in machine learning and artificial intelligence (cs.AI, cs.LG). The paper also mentions that the proposed method can handle tokenization errors, which is a common problem in NMT and could fall under the neural networks (cs.NE) sub-category. Finally, the paper includes experimental results on Chinese-English translation, which could also fall under the computer vision (cs.CV) sub-category if the translation involves image or video data.
